abstract: When the Mass started in 1953, there were no Catholic members of the Supreme Court. Today, there are six Catholic justices, three Jewish justices and, for the first time in history, no Protestant justices.
snippet: When the Mass started in 1953, there were no Catholic members of the Supreme Court. Today, there are six Catholic justices, three Jewish justices and, for the first time in history, no Protestant justices.

headline.main: Red Mass Marks Start of Supreme Court Session
